header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS

central_thesis: The Tarot, when approached through a specific esoteric framework, can serve as a safe and effective tool for developing supersensory perceptions and spiritual awareness, not by awakening primitive psychic faculties, but by fostering self-conscious control and raising consciousness to superconscious levels. This approach aims to achieve cosmic awareness rather than merely enhancing psychic abilities.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to Supersensory Powers and Tarot
structure_content.summary: Introduces the tenth lesson's focus on developing supersensory powers through Tarot, emphasizing its unique ability to safely awaken psychic faculties. It contrasts Western and Eastern approaches to spiritual development, highlighting the Western emphasis on building the 'Temple Within' amidst the 'mass mind' and the dangers of uncontrolled psychic awakenings.

Differentiates between psychic and spiritual powers, positing that psychic faculties are primitive aspects of consciousness residing in the subconscious. It warns against mistaking psychic abilities for spiritual attainment and illustrates the dangers of uncontrolled psychic development, which can lead to obsession and derangement. The text emphasizes the need for self-conscious understanding and control.

structure_content.chapter_title: Western vs. Eastern Paths and Dangers of Psychic Development
structure_content.summary: Explains why Western spiritual development differs from Eastern traditions, necessitating a unique approach to consciousness expansion. It details the severe risks associated with forcefully opening psychic centers (chakras) or engaging in passive psychic practices (like sitting in circles), which can lead to obsessions, mental deterioration, and possession by lower consciousness forms or entities.

structure_content.chapter_title: Tarot as a Safe Method for Psychic Development
structure_content.summary: Positions Tarot as a superior and safer method for developing supersensory perception. It outlines that each Tarot key contains principles of consciousness and can be used with special techniques to extend awareness and control. The lesson introduces the Fool (Key 0) as the representation of superconscious power.

Focuses on the first Tarot key, the Fool, symbolizing superconscious power. It deconstructs the common negative perception of 'foolishness' as ignorance of the material world and encourages embracing this state as a means to transcend physical hypnosis. The text emphasizes that true power lies in conscious awareness of the 'Eternal Now' and the need to expand this present moment awareness to attain higher states of consciousness.

Concludes by stressing that comprehending superconsciousness requires direct experience, not just intellectual understanding. The Tarot keys are presented as guides or 'maps' to this experience, which is the ultimate goal of spiritual growth. It encourages engaging in spiritual and psychological exercises to achieve this.

key_concepts.definition: Abilities beyond the normal five physical senses, including clairvoyance, clairaudience, telepathy, and clairsentience. The text differentiates these from spiritual powers, viewing them as primitive subconscious faculties.

The primitive subconscious aspects of consciousness that give rise to supersensory perceptions. The text cautions that these can be dangerous if not understood and controlled, often leading to lower states of consciousness and derangement if awakened improperly.

The process of developing dominion over oneself (thinking, feeling, attitudes) and establishing right relationships with oneself, others, and the Universal Creator. It is distinguished from mere psychic development, aiming for cosmic awareness.

The process of spiritual evolution, particularly within the Western esoteric context, which involves building the 'Temple Within' and expanding consciousness, often contrasted with Eastern withdrawal practices.

The first Tarot key, representing superconscious power. Its symbolism encourages a non-attachment to material reality and an embrace of the present moment ('nowness') as the gateway to spiritual realization.

The ultimate objective of the course, a state of expanded awareness and self-conscious understanding that transcends the limitations of the individual personality and the subconscious mind, achieved by rising to superconscious levels.
The present moment, viewed as the only time available for experiencing illumination and freedom. Expanding this 'nowness' is key to attaining the higher superconscious state of knowing.

practical_system.description: The system presented uses specific Tarot keys, particularly the Fool (Key 0), as vehicles for developing controlled supersensory perception and ultimately cosmic consciousness. The approach emphasizes understanding and consciously directing psychic faculties, which are viewed as primitive subconscious powers, rather than allowing them to dominate. The method involves a structured progression through Tarot keys, using special techniques to extend awareness and control. The core practice involves experiential work guided by the Tarot, focusing on the expansion of self-conscious awareness within the 'Eternal Now' to attain higher superconscious states. This is presented as a Western esoteric method that contrasts with Eastern practices, focusing on integration within the 'mass mind' rather than withdrawal.
tools: Tarot cards (specifically the Fool key initially)

relevant_quotes.text: We shall show why it is that Tarot is perhaps one of the few ways by which one can safely awaken the psychic faculties, our supersensory perceptions.

Psychic faculties are not spiritual powers, although many aspirants have mistaken them for such. As a matter of fact, all animals are psychic, and practically all primitive people are psychic. We might say that the psychic faculties represent one of the most primitive levels of human consciousness rather than one of its highest powers.
Thus it is that in so many tragic cases, those who deliberately awaken their psychic faculties end by being dominated by this primitive level to the point of derangement.
Perhaps the most dangerous method is that used by those who concentrate on the merely psychic aspects of aspiration and think they are achieving spiritual growth.

The reason for this will be explained to you as you learn the techniques for using the various Tarot keys. Bear continually in mind that while our understanding of psychic faculties and the development of supersensory perception brings about an expanded awareness and an ability to control both ourselves and our conditions, this understanding and development must be attained in a very special way in order to be both safe and effective.

In this class of lessons, the objective is controlled supersensory perception and psychic power, and the main objective within that framework is the attainment of cosmic awareness or cosmic consciousness.
The great problem that confronts the aspirant is that he lies under an hypnosis in terms of the physical plane... The one thing you can take with you is consciousness.
All esoteric schools of thought tell us consistently that the only time you can experience illumination, the only time you can gain freedom from the dream, is now.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners and students of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in Tarot's application beyond divination or mere psychological interpretation. It offers a framework for integrating Tarot into a structured path of consciousness development, focusing on controlled psychic and spiritual growth. Its emphasis on safety and distinguishing true spiritual advancement from primitive psychic phenomena aligns with critical concerns in occult studies.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Advanced students of esoteric traditions, specifically those engaged with the Builders of the Adytum (B.O.T.A.) or similar Tarot-based systems. It is also relevant for individuals interested in developing psychic abilities but seeking a structured, safe, and spiritually grounded method, and those critical of uncontrolled or sensationalized psychic development.
